about.description:
libiio is used to interface to the Linux Industrial Input/Output (IIO) Subsystem.
The Linux IIO subsystem is intended to provide support for devices that in some
sense are analog to digital or digital to analog converters (ADCs, DACs). This
includes, but is not limited to ADCs, Accelerometers, Gyros, IMUs, Capacitance to
Digital Converters (CDCs), Pressure Sensors, Color, Light and Proximity Sensors,
Temperature Sensors, Magnetometers, DACs, DDS (Direct Digital Synthesis), PLLs
(Phase Locked Loops), Variable/Programmable Gain Amplifiers (VGA, PGA), and RF
transceivers. You can use libiio natively on an embedded Linux target (local mode),
or use libiio to communicate remotely to that same target from a host Linux,
Windows or MAC over USB or Ethernet or Serial.
about.summary: Library for interfacing with Linux IIO devices

name: libiio-c
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.4
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: libiio-c
  version: '0.21'
source:
  - patches:
      - 0002-Python-Do-not-verify-whether-libiio-is-installed-when-cross-compiling.patch
    sha256: 03d13165cbeb83b036743cbd9a10e336c728da162714f39d13250a3d94305cac
    url: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio/archive/v0.21.tar.gz
build:
  number: 5
  run_exports:
    - libiio-c >=0.21,<0.22.0a0
  string: h34f4286_5
requirements:
  build:
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
    - binutils_impl_linux-aarch64 2.35.1 h026399b_2
    - binutils_linux-aarch64 2.35 hcd9001c_30
    - bzip2 1.0.8 hf897c2e_4
    - c-ares 1.17.1 hf897c2e_1
    - ca-certificates 2020.12.5 h4fd8a4c_0
    - centos-release-cos7-aarch64 7 h9d98e8f_1104
    - cmake 3.20.2 h4bdbfb5_0
    - expat 2.3.0 h3621d8e_0
    - gcc_impl_linux-aarch64 9.3.0 h88a1608_19
    - gcc_linux-aarch64 9.3.0 h5551ba8_30
    - kernel-headers_linux-aarch64 4.18.0 hca5cc2b_10
    - kmod-cos7-aarch64 20 h9d98e8f_1104
    - krb5 1.17.2 he08ec14_0
    - ld_impl_linux-aarch64 2.35.1 h02ad14f_2
    - libcurl 7.76.1 h362eb50_1
    - libedit 3.1.20191231 he28a2e2_2
    - libev 4.33 h516909a_1
    - libgcc-devel_linux-aarch64 9.3.0 h246fbc7_19
    - libgcc-ng 9.3.0 he1ea209_19
    - libgomp 9.3.0 he1ea209_19
    - libnghttp2 1.43.0 h097699d_0
    - libssh2 1.9.0 h1ab2c7b_6
    - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 h1ed1776_19
    - libuv 1.41.0 hf897c2e_0
    - lz4-c 1.9.3 h01db608_0
    - make 4.3 h309ac5b_1
    - ncurses 6.2 h7fd3ca4_4
    - openssl 1.1.1k hf897c2e_0
    - rhash 1.4.1 hf897c2e_0
    - sysroot_linux-aarch64 2.17 h4744778_10
    - systemd-cos7-aarch64 219 h9d98e8f_1104
    - systemd-devel-cos7-aarch64 219 h9d98e8f_1104
    - systemd-libs-cos7-aarch64 219 h9d98e8f_1104
    - tk 8.6.10 ha99a2a3_1
    - xz 5.2.5 h6dd45c4_1
    - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1009
    - zstd 1.4.9 h41fb7a4_0
  host:
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
    - bison 3.4 h7fd3ca4_1
    - flex 2.6.4 h884eca8_1004
    - icu 68.1 h884eca8_0
    - libaio 0.3.112 hf897c2e_0
    - libgcc-ng 9.3.0 he1ea209_19
    - libgomp 9.3.0 he1ea209_19
    - libiconv 1.16 h6dd45c4_0
    - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 h1ed1776_19
    - libusb 1.0.24 hdb429d0_4
    - libxml2 2.9.10 hd674cf7_4
    - m4 1.4.18 h516909a_1001
    - patchelf 0.11 h4c5d2ac_0
    - xz 5.2.5 h6dd45c4_1
    - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1009
  run:
    - libaio >=0.3.112,<0.4.0a0
    - libgcc-ng >=9.3.0
    - libusb >=1.0.24,<2.0a0
    - libxml2 >=2.9.10,<2.10.0a0
test:
  commands:
    - iio_attr --help
    - iio_genxml --help
    - iio_info --help
    - iio_readdev --help
    - iio_reg --help
    - iio_writedev --help
    - iio_adi_xflow_check --help
    - iiod --help
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/iio.h
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libiio${SHLIB_EXT}
about:
  description: 'libiio is used to interface to the Linux Industrial Input/Output (IIO)
    Subsystem.

    The Linux IIO subsystem is intended to provide support for devices that in some

    sense are analog to digital or digital to analog converters (ADCs, DACs). This

    includes, but is not limited to ADCs, Accelerometers, Gyros, IMUs, Capacitance
    to

    Digital Converters (CDCs), Pressure Sensors, Color, Light and Proximity Sensors,

    Temperature Sensors, Magnetometers, DACs, DDS (Direct Digital Synthesis), PLLs

    (Phase Locked Loops), Variable/Programmable Gain Amplifiers (VGA, PGA), and RF

    transceivers. You can use libiio natively on an embedded Linux target (local mode),

    or use libiio to communicate remotely to that same target from a host Linux,

    Windows or MAC over USB or Ethernet or Serial.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio
  doc_url: https://analogdevicesinc.github.io/libiio/
  home: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio
  license: LGPL-2.1-or-later AND GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file:
    - COPYING.txt
    - COPYING_GPL.txt
  summary: Library for interfacing with Linux IIO devices
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: libiio
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ryanvolz
